Issues.Title: AutomationElement for MenuItems has changed in a breaking way
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK:
 Version:   8.0.100-rc.1.23463.5
 Commit:    e7f4de8816

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.22621
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\8.0.100-rc.1.23463.5\

.NET workloads installed:
There are no installed workloads to display.

Host:
  Version:      8.0.0-rc.1.23419.4
  Architecture: x64
  Commit:       92959931a3
  RID:          win-x64

.NET SDKs installed:
  3.1.426 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  6.0.415 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  7.0.402 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  8.0.100-rc.1.23463.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.1.32 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.23 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 7.0.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 8.0.0-rc.1.23421.29 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.32 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.23 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 7.0.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 8.0.0-rc.1.23419.4 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.32 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.23 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 7.0.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 8.0.0-rc.1.23420.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

Other architectures found:
  x86   [C:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet]
    registered at [HKLM\SOFTWARE\dotnet\Setup\InstalledVersions\x86\InstallLocation]

Environment variables:
  Not set

global.json file:
  Not found

Learn more:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet/info

Download .NET:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet/download






### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I'm using .NET 7.0.  Same problem in .NET Framework 4.8 but not in .NET Framework 4.7.2

### Issue description

AutomationElements for menu items have disappeared so I cannot automate my application any more.  The app is https://github.com/microsoft/XmlNotepad and the unit tests all use AutomationElement and the tests work fine on commit c47d66e5ae1552d8a9e1b898b235a01f4b1f821c but not in the latest master branch.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create new WinForms app with a menuStrip with one item "File" and put menu items in this File menu named "New" and "Open"
2. run the app
3. run C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\bin\10.0.22621.0\x64\inspect.exe

Hover over the file menu, notice it has a little + sign next to it, but when you click the + no sub menu items appear.

This was not the case in .NET 4.7.2 where the sub menu items were all perfectly accessible.

Alternate repro:
1. clone https://github.com/microsoft/XmlNotepad,
2. load src\XmlNotepad.sln
3. Run all unit tests

They all fail on .NET 4.8, but they pass on .NET 4.7.2.  In particular you will see a difference in the menu item iteration in the ReloadMenuItems function where the expression `FindAll(TreeScope.Descendants,  new PropertyCondition(AutomationElement.ControlTypeProperty, ControlType.MenuItem)` no longer finds all the menu items.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AutomationElement for MenuItems has changed in a breaking way" (#10109)

Issues.Title: After moving Button on the Manually Align Controls by hand page of the DemoConsole application, it fails to focus on component controls
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo without buttons

### Issue description

In the Align Controls by hand page of the [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test application in the Winforms repo, moving Button3 or Button4 and then clicking on component control, the component control cannot be focused and moved.

### Steps to reproduce

Actual result in DemoConsole application when testing main branch:



https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/108860782/e838fc43-2456-4b6f-8496-a2a5fcd843fe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "After moving Button on the Manually Align Controls by hand page of the DemoConsole application, it fails to focus on component controls" (#10082)

Issues.Title: Clean DesignerTransaction after DesignerTransaction committed
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #10082 


## Proposed changes

- Set DesignerTransaction to null after submitting CleanDesignerTransaction
- When there is no substantial positional movement of the internal control, cancel the DesignerTransaction directly to avoid _insertionIndex=-1 causing an exception in code line [while (_insertionIndex < _childInfo.Length - 1 && _childInfo[_insertionIndex].InSelectionCollection) ](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/e6d1ad98adb7825970935942de483273912c82f1/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/FlowLayoutPanelDesigner%20.cs#L593C8-L593C109)

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- All of the control can be selected normally in Demo project

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/108860782/e838fc43-2456-4b6f-8496-a2a5fcd843fe

### After

![AfterChanging](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/3c76229d-26fb-45b3-bb5a-5d1f00f9cb98)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

-  .net  9.0.0-alpha.1.23508.5


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: Smart tag panel of ToolStripContainer does not open in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works well in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9750 Verification result.

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, Smart tag panel of ToolStripContainer does not open.

**Actual result** in DemoConsole application when testing **main branch**:
![testToolStripContainer](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/00b843b6-e331-4c25-b5a9-80ebfd1e80d2)

**Expected result** in DemoConsole application when testing in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9750:
![testtoolstrip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/cf514b45-7b1a-4cb4-857c-45e770ef4a9d)


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Smart tag panel of ToolStripContainer does not open in DemoConsole application" (#10097)

Issues.Title: System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works well in .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo. The original issue is [9412](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9412).

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo.
Actual result in DemoConsole application when **testing main branch**:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/80c58b85-6df8-4d5b-acf7-2a7655cbc567

**Call Stack:**
System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Design
  StackTrace:
   at System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.DeserializeModifier(IDesignerSerializationManager manager, String name, Object state) in C:\test\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\src\System\ComponentModel\Design\Serialization\CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.cs:line 421

  This exception was originally thrown at this call stack:
    System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.DeserializeModifier(System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager, string, object) in CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.cs

Expected result in DemoConsole application when **testing release/8.0 branch**:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/bcaf868f-1ff7-4f16-bbf5-942a3e1b1cfe



### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo in DemoConsole application" (#10096)

Issues.Title: [Announcement] Dreddy-work is signing off!
Issues.Body:
After having served as the repository owner and maintainer for the past year, I am embarking on a new chapter within Microsoft. This journey has been genuinely rewarding, and together, we have made great progress in advancing WinForms and nurturing a thriving community. WinForms has played a significant role in my Microsoft career, and I intend to continue contributing to this repository in a contributor capacity whenever the opportunity arises.

I'd like to express my sincere thanks to @lonitra for accepting the responsibility of taking over as the repository owner and maintainer moving forward.

Please don't hesitate to mention me in issues or pull requests where my input could be valuable.

Thank you, everyone!
Devendar
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Announcement] Dreddy-work is signing off!" (#10094)

Issues.Title: DesignerUtils refactorings
Issues.Body:
Also extracted from #9381

## Proposed changes

- Modernisation of `DesignerUtils`' code
- Change signature of methods `GenerateSnapShotWithBitBlt` and `GenerateSnapShotWithWM_PRINT` to better reflect their action

Issues.Title: Replace ArrayList with List in DesignerUtils
Issues.Body:
Extracted from #9381. Contributes to #8140

## Proposed changes

- Replace `ArrayList`s with `List`s in `DesignerUtils`


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10091)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace ArrayList with List in DesignerUtils" (#10091)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in DesignerActionPanel
Issues.Body:
Now that #10035 is merged, my plan is to annotate just `DesignerActionPanel`, and then rebase #9367 to remove the annotation changes I made on it there, but keep all the other changes with their review.

My changes here include the modification of the annotation of a public interface. The two internal implementers of method `IWindowsFormsEditorService.DropDownControl` cannot handle a null `Control` as argument, and nothing in the docs said the implementers should prepare for that scenario

## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `DesignerActionPanel`
- Update nullability annotations of interface `IWindowsFormsEditorService`


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10088)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable nullability in DesignerActionPanel" (#10088)
